availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1862-1863

body.p: State of Ohio, Hamilton County, S.S.

To the Keeper of the jail in the County aforesaid Whereas, William Fisher and May ann Malone, of Campbell County State of Kentucky, has been arrested on an oath of T. I Fisher, for unlawfully stealing and takingaway, one Bay Horse, and one Rockaway,, valued at $500. property of said affiant, and had been brought before me, a justice of the peace in and for the County of Hamilton, & upon examination of T. I. Fisher by me, and finding that the offence was committed in Campbell County State of Kentucky, you are therefore Commanded in the name of the state of Ohio to receive the Bodys of said May ann Malone & William Fisher, toin the jail of Hamilton County, then to wait the requisition of the Governor of the state of Kentucky
Given under my hand this 24" day of February A.D. 1863.

John W. Carter J. P.
of Cincinati Township
